inclusion.criterion: All children aged 8-17 years presenting to the paediatric ED with: A chief complaint of colicky abdominal pain AND Pain score of at least 4/10 on the Faces Pain Scale - Revised AND A presumed non-surgical etiology
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Concomitant use of other anticholinergic medication including but not limited to tricyclic antidepressants, antihistamines, benztropine mesylate
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Signs and symptoms consistent with a bowel obstruction
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Suspected previous hypersensitivity reaction to either acetaminophen or HBB
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of abdominal trauma within 48 hours of presentation
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 31-year-old woman complaining of abdominal pain. She had poor appetite as well as malaise.
